title.rendered: “IDF Strikes Hezbollah Targets: Inside Israel’s Broad Attack on Lebanese Terror Infrastructure”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

A terrorist cell, launch site, military compounds, operational command and terror infrastructure; the IDF has completed a broad attack on Lebanese territory

A short while ago, Israeli Air Force fighter jets attacked two military compounds belonging to the terror organization Hezbollah. The compounds were significant assets for the organization, including a military compound used by Hezbollah’s ground-to-air missile unit.

Additionally, a short while ago, fighter jets, aircraft of the air force and other IDF forces attacked a range of targets belonging to the Hezbollah terror organization in over thirty locations – Al-Tallet, Ramiyah, May al-Jabal and Ayta al-Shaab in southern Lebanon. Among the targets attacked were terror infrastructures, a terrorist cell, a launch site, and an operational command.

During the day, several launches from Lebanon were detected towards the open areas of Yiftah and Avivim.

Also, earlier today a surface-to-air missile was launched towards a long-range manned aircraft of the Air Force over Lebanese territory. The aircraft was not damaged and continued its mission, the missile did not cross into Israeli territory.

Attached is footage from the attacks: https://bit.ly/47vezkS
